title: Fact check: Flood image of BMW with anti-Greta Thunberg sticker is a fake
description: As deadly floods ravaged Germany and other parts of western Europe this week, an image began circulating on social media -- among people speaking multiple languages.

title: A Mercedes once owned by U2's Bono is going up for auction
description: A Mercedes once owned by singer Bono of U2 is going up for auction Sunday.

title: The 'wet bulb' warning
description: Extreme heat is less spectacularly violent than an earthquake or hurricane, but from 2015 to 2019 it killed more people than any other weather hazard. Last month's blistering heat waves in the US Pacific Northwest and Western Canada left hundreds of people dead, as these normally temperate regions grappled with record-breaking temperatures. With just over 100 days to go until the COP26 United Nations Climate Change Conference, these incidents are a tragic reminder that adapting to an increasingly hostile climate is as urgent as ever.

title: Before you book your next trip, try this TikTok guru's travel tips
description: Ben Kielesinski spent the pandemic transporting his followers out of lockdowns and into ice caves, lush forests and waterfalls. From where to go to how to pack, he shares his tips for ensuring your next vacation is the trip of a lifetime.

title: Desperate search for survivors as western Europe reels from a 'catastrophe of historic proportion'
description: The number of people killed in the catastrophic flooding across parts of western Europe rose to 157 on Saturday morning, as a desperate search for survivors continues despite rising waters, landslides and power outages.

title: Sun, sea and golf and the challenge of playing in gusty wind, unforgiving rough and blind shots
description: Most people can't wait to head to the coast and sample the delights of the sun, sea, sand and an ice cream or two.

title: England's footballers lost the Euro 2020 final. But they might yet win the culture war
description: This year's Euro 2020 tournament has become a national talking point in the UK -- but not just about football.

title: Black tech entrepreneurs get $1 million boost from Pharrell Williams
description: Entrepreneur Justin Turk knew his start-up was special, but a $1 million prize from Grammy award-winning singer and producer Pharrell Williams came as a shock.

title: Living on Earth while your dad walks on the moon
description: There is something about stargazing that inspires us to dream, to imagine the impossible. What if, as you looked to the stars, you were envisioning your next destination?

title: Is Hunter Biden's art any good?
description: Hunter Biden has been many things over his 51 years. But, in the last few years at least, he has been an artist.

title: More inclusive emoji, including one of a pregnant man, may be coming to smartphones
description: More inclusive emojis may be coming to future software updates, including one of a pregnant man.

title: Jeff Bezos is flying to space. Here's everything you need to know
description: Jeff Bezos, the richest man on the planet, is preparing for a rocket-powered, 11-minute 2,300-mph excursion to the edge of space, capping off a month filled with rocket news and a bit of drama among the world's richest people who are dedicating large portions of their wealth to rocket development.

title: What's the best pizza city in the USA? 'Modernist' authors have a surprise for you
description: It's not up to you after all, New York. And Chicago -- the wind has been taken out of your deep dish sails.

title: Why it seems like everyone hates the English abroad
description: When England played Italy in the Euros 2020 soccer final on July 11, the images went around the world.

title: 2020 election becomes early dividing line for Republicans in crucial 2022 Senate race in Arizona
description: In one of next year's most consequential Senate races, the Republican primary to take on Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly of Arizona is turning on a question: Who won the 2020 presidential election?

title: Biz Markie, 'Just A Friend' rapper, dead at 57
description: Biz Markie, who infused his music with so much fun and humor that he became known as "The Clown Prince of Hip Hop," has died, his manager, Jenni Izumi, confirmed to CNN.

title: Oil wresting, Venice cruising and a honeymoon boom: 10 things we learned in Covid travel this week
description: Saturday is here -- which means that it's time once again for CNN Travel to check the destination barometer and tell you where's hot, where's not and where you'll need your two shots.

title: Great Salt Lake is shrinking fast. Scientists demand action before it becomes a toxic dustbin
description: Great Salt Lake is also known as America's Dead Sea -- owing to a likeness to its much smaller Middle Eastern counterpart -- but scientists worry the moniker could soon take new meaning.

title: Sunscreen recall: What the finding of a cancer-causing chemical means for you
description: The burning heat of summer has us all reaching for sunscreens. But before you slather that product on your skin, first check to see if it is part of a voluntary recall by sunscreen brands  Neutrogena and Aveeno.

title: Missing Ugandan Olympic hopeful left note saying he wants to work in Japan
description: A Ugandan athlete who has gone missing in Tokyo ahead of the Olympic Games had left a note saying his life in the African country was too difficult and he wanted to work in Japan, officials have said.

title: In pictures: Deadly flooding in western Europe
description: Severe flooding caused by historic rainfall has led to dozens of deaths in western Europe, and hundreds of people are missing.

title: Athletes could face the warmest Olympic Games in decades
description: With the Olympic Games opening ceremonies less than a week away, all eyes will be on the weather forecast.

title: Ana Carrasco broke her back after a 'stupid' crash. Eight months later she raced to victory
description: On September 10, 2020, motorcycle racer Ana Carrasco was lying in the gravel at the side of Lisbon's famous Estoril circuit, barely conscious, surrounded by concerned medics.

title: Palestinians describe fight against a West Bank settlement as an existential battle. Jewish settlers say the same
description: A small boy sits on a hillside in the occupied West Bank. Like the adults around him, he trains a green laser beam on a group of prefabricated housing units on a hilltop a few hundred meters away. It is an act of defiance.

title: First case of Covid-19 reported at Tokyo Olympic village
description: A person has tested positive for Covid-19 at the Tokyo Olympics athletes' village, organizers said on Saturday, in the first such case that adds to concerns about infections at the Games which begin next week.

title: 'Hollywood Ripper' serial killer sentenced to death
description: The man known as the "Hollywood Ripper" was sentenced to death on Friday in the murders of two women and the attempted murder of another, a court spokesperson told CNN.

title: Australian and WNBA star Liz Cambage withdraws from Olympics, citing mental health
description: The Australian Olympic Committee (AOC) has announced that women's basketball player Liz Cambage -- a star player on the WNBA's Las Vegas Aces -- has withdrawn from the Australian Olympic Team and will not compete in Tokyo.

title: These two countries plan to 'live with Covid.' Their approaches are worlds apart
description: More than a year and a half into the coronavirus pandemic, the world's rich nations are beginning to accept that Covid-19 is not going away -- despite high vaccination rates drastically cutting the number of hospitalizations and deaths.

title: Black man tased after allegedly helping someone evade subway fare
description: NYPD officers tased a man on the subway after he was seen allegedly letting someone through a gate to skip the fee.
